meanings.definition: A loyal, reliable, and hardworking supporter or participant.
meanings.sent1: The stalwarts of the team always show up early to practice.
meanings.sent2: The political party's stalwarts campaigned tirelessly for their candidate.
meanings.sent3: The stalwarts of the gardening club never forgot to water the plants, even in a storm.
meanings.sent4: She was the stalwart of the family, holding everyone together during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The stalwarts of the community were honored for their dedication at the annual event.

meanings.definition: A person who is steadfast in their allegiance or opinions.
meanings.sent1: Despite criticism, he remained a stalwart supporter of the cause.
meanings.sent2: The stalwarts of the debate team never wavered in their arguments.
meanings.sent3: Even in the face of a tempting offer, she stayed a stalwart believer in her principles.
meanings.sent4: His unwavering loyalty made him a stalwart in the eyes of his friends.
meanings.sent5: The stalwarts of the book club never missed a meeting, showing their dedication to reading.
